snippet: Actions have been taken against Chinese grain exports, India’s barriers to solar-panel parts, European subsidies for airliner manufacturing and foreign fishing subsidies....
abstract: Obama administration is using World Trade Organization's recent actions against unfair trade practices in China, India and Europe to win over opponents of Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement; stresses passage of pact will raise trade standards and provide more tools WTO can use for enforcement.
lead_paragraph: Actions have been taken against Chinese grain exports, India’s barriers to solar-panel parts, European subsidies for airliner manufacturing and foreign fishing subsidies.

headline.main: Obama Hails Enforcement on Trade Deals to Win Support for T.P.P.
headline.print_headline: Obama Hails Action on Trade to Promote Pacific Pact
